  • HP LaserJet 1000 on OS X Mavericks

  • HP LaserJet 1000 is an old printer model that is not supported on Mac OS X. However, using foo2zjs printer driver for ZjStream protocol it is possible to configure OS X Mavericks (as well as Snow Leopard, Lion, and Mountain Lion) to support HP LaserJet 1000. Here are instructions on how to set it up.

    Foo2zjs is an open source printer driver, and it is recommended not to use precompiled packages, but to compile from the source tarball provided at foo2zjs home page. Therefore, before you actually compile it, make sure to have Xcode installed. Xcode is a package provided by Apple containing compilers, libraries and additional tools required to develop and compile applications for Mac OS X. The latest version of Xcode is available at Mac App Store, but it could be also downloaded from the Apple developer website. Once Xcode is installed, from the Terminal application (/Applications/Utilities/Terminal.app) command line, run:

        $ xcode-select --install

    and click the Install button to install the required command line developer tools. The same tools could be downloaded from the Apple developer website as well.

    Beside Xcode, since foo2zjs building process is based on Makefile, a few additional command line tools (autoconf, automake, wget, and gsed) have to be installed. Also, since the driver uses Ghostscript (PostScript and PDF interpreter) to perform image processing, this application is required as well. Installation of all these applications could be easily done via MacPorts open-source software installer system. Mac OS X package installer provided at MacPorts home page, automatically installs MacPorts, sets the shell environment, and runs a selfupdate operation to update the ports tree and MacPorts base with the latest release. To confirm the installation is working as expected, from the Terminal application, run:

        $ port version

    Using MacPorts main utility, port command, Ghostscript and additional command line tools (autoconf and automake are provided within coreutils package) can be installed with the following command:

        $ sudo port install ghostscript coreutils wget gsed

    Foo2zjs uses Foomatic scripts to convert the incoming PostScript data into the printer's native format. Fortunately, Foomatic package installer are provided by the Linux Foundation and it could be downloaded from http://www.linuxfoundation.org/collaborate/workgroups/openprinting/macosxfoomatic.

    Now proceed with foo2zjs printer driver installation by following these steps:

    • Change home directory:

          $ cd /tmp

    • Download foo2zjs source tarball :

          $ wget http://foo2zjs.rkkda.com/foo2zjs.tar.gz

    • Extract all files from the tarball:

          $ tar zxvf foo2zjs.tar.gz

    • Go to the extracted directory:

          $ cd foo2zjs

    • Compile foo2zjs source:

          $ make

    • Download HP LaserJet 1000 firmware file:

          $ ./getweb 1000

    • Download foo2zjs printer driver:

          $ sudo make install

    • Optionally (but recommended), install hot-plug utility that loads the firmware automatically when the printer is plugged in (or turned on):

          $ sudo make install-hotplug

      Otherwise, with the following command the firmware file has to be sent manually each time the printer is powered on:

          $ sudo lp -oraw /usr/share/foo2zjs/firmware/sihp1000.dl

    If all steps passed successfully, add the printer (HP LaserJet 1000 Foomatic/foo2zjs) via Printers & Scanners pane in System Preferences.

This page was last modified on 04 Aug 2014.
